609cd41f-98bb-4d64-af5e-055bc5f357d9.description: This individual is competent in initiating, planning, executing, monitoring, controlling, and closing projects and programs and has learned to adapt and apply best practices to traditional products using waterfall methodologies as well as highly developmental products using contemporary lean-agile frameworks. They practice collaborative leadership and are prepared for the Project Management Institute’s PMP® exam and qualify for the Master Project Manager® credential.
609cd41f-98bb-4d64-af5e-055bc5f357d9.name: Project and Program Management

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed three core courses: Role of the Project Manager, Project Integration and Risk Management or Project Leadership and Communication; and Applied Project Management; as well as three electives. Earned 15 credit units representing 150 contact hours. Met all requirements for a UCSC Silicon Valley Extension Certificate in Project and Program Management.

As an Authorized Training Partner for the Project Management Institute® (PMI®), students can earn professional development units toward each of the seven PMI professional certifications. Our courses are compliant with A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge, PMBOK® Guide and they prepare students to sit for the PMP® exam.

badge_template_activities.title: Live-online sessions per week, and an additional four to six hours completing assignments and project work. 8 CEUs

b0e1d022-bcfe-4ee4-af06-f955f0d38f4c.description: Individuals learned to identify, motivate, develop and support employees in any field. Earned at least 15 units. Met all requirements for a UCSC Silicon Valley Certificate in Human Resources Management.

UCSC Silicon Valley Extension's Human Resource Management certificate program meets the criteria for pre-approved recertification credit(s) for any of HRCI’s eight credentials, including SPHR® and PHR®; and, as a SHRM Recertification General Provider, each course is valid for a designated number of PDCs for the SHRM-CP® or SHRM-SCP®.

9cbbf340-f2a1-4375-a2f9-a4c2617ccaf6.description: UX professionals who completed this program can implement visual and user experience design principles and the iterative and user-centered design process with the spiral model to develop compelling user experiences. e35c4b55-9729-4b2e-8b49-cf49bb791f48.description: Individuals in this program have mastered the practical aspects of running and managing a clinical trial, such as trial design and phases, good clinical practices, the drug discovery and development process, and quality control and assurance. They are familiar with the numerous legal and ethical issues of clinical research, including FDA regulations and ICH guidelines, compliance, and bioethics.
e35c4b55-9729-4b2e-8b49-cf49bb791f48.name: Clinical Trials Design and Management

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed two prerequisites: Human Physiology in Health and Disease and Medical / Clinical Terminology; five core courses: Principles of Drug Discovery and Development; Clinical Statistics for Non-Statisticians; Clinical Trials Site Monitoring; Good Clinical Practices; Science of Clinical Trials Design; either Medical Devices: Regulatory Strategies and Marketing Pathways or Regulation of Medical Devices and Diagnostics; minimum two electives. Earned 19 units. Met all certificate requirements.
Dual Certificates can be earned in Clinical Trials and one of the following: Biotechnology, Medical Devices, or Regulatory Affairs. Details can be found at the bottom of the certificate page.

Many Clinical Trials Design and Management courses qualify for continuing education credit for professional organizations and credentials, including the Association of Clinical Research Professional (ACRP), the California Board of Registered Nursing (BRN); and the the Regulatory Affairs Certification (RAC) exam.

fb240636-8112-417f-bbdb-21a63bd1dfbf.description: This individual is able to identify critical roles in the industry, best practices for product documentation and risk management and knows of industry requirements, federal regulations and audits, and global standards. Earned 19 units. Met all requirements for a UCSC Silicon Valley Certificate in Regulatory Affairs.

Our Regulatory Affairs program helps prepare professionals with three to five years in the regulatory field for the Regulatory Affairs Certification (RAC) exam. Upon completion, students may transfer credit toward a master's program at Northeastern University.
Dual Certificates can be earned in Regulatory Affairs and one of the following: Biotechnology, Clinical Trials, or Medical Devices. Details can be found at the bottom of the certificate page.

3817c7de-4672-46a2-9e03-ef44e286c9c9.description: Individuals who complete this course have acquired a better understanding of key personal attributes to help navigate their professional relationships, support the greater good of an organization, and be more successful in their career. Students received a 70% or higher on all end-of-module assessments.

4a0ba653-5d19-4fc8-84b1-c91bc5e7b907.description: Individuals have a solid comprehension of basic concepts and the language of biotechnology. 4394e88f-4604-463e-93ce-4678c1a567fc.description: Badge recipients are trained in the current knowledge and practices of Agile product life-cycle management (APLM), including Lean-Agile principles, systems thinking, Scrum and Kanban methodologies, and the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe©) for Lean Enterprises. They understand bilingual and English language development and can evaluate others’ English abilities and teach grammar and writing.
c3fc9194-7e2c-4d66-b8cd-2723a2e5b4bf.name: TESOL - Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed six core courses: Assessment, Evaluation and Placement; Culture and Cultural Diversity; First and Second Language Development; Fundamentals of English Grammar for ESL Teachers; Language Structure; and Methodology of Bilingual and English Language Development; as well as three electives. Earned at least 27 units. Met all requirements for a UCSC Silicon Valley Certificate in TESOL.
Students may transfer TESOL Certificate units toward master's programs at University of San Francisco and Notre Dame de Namur University.

7935e70b-1391-4838-bb08-d6ec7d22312a.description: Individuals in the DEI for Educators Specialization acquired a comprehensive understanding of historical inequalities and how feelings are affixed to historic trauma. They are aware of scientific data speaking to physiological threat and trauma reactions to discrimination and microaggressions. They learned new ways to challenge social, cultural and economic inequalities imposed on individuals and to cultivate environments that empower students to resolve conflicts.
7935e70b-1391-4838-bb08-d6ec7d22312a.name: DEI for Educators Specialization

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the following courses: Culture and Cultural Diversity; Introduction to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI); Learning Theories and Styles; Neurodivergent Learners. Met all the requirements for DEI for Educators Specialization. Earned CEUs and UC credits.

2a0efa0f-b2fb-48a3-b872-adb46d68d51c.description: Recipients of the Professional Writing and Technical Communication Specialization have enhanced skills beyond the basics of writing and editing. Students have worked to enhance their skills to effectively communicate technical details and utilize industry-specific terminology when writing for specific workplace audiences. Students have explored tools, worked on identifying errors in content and context structure, and identified the challenges editors face beyond editing documents.
2a0efa0f-b2fb-48a3-b872-adb46d68d51c.name: Professional Writing and Technical Communication

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed at least 4 of the courses available. Met all requirements for Professional Writing and Technical Communication Specialization. Earned at least 6 units, which may result in a mix of UC credit and CEUs.

skills.name: Adaptability To Work With Modern Tools

9c8c2657-bcd0-4bf6-a542-d0994d9b073e.description: Individuals will have earned 10 Salesforce Trailhead badges. They will be well versed in data and sales intelligence tools, the concepts of lead generation, lead qualification, and pipeline management. They will have created a Strategic Sales Development Playbook to showcase sales knowledge and selling capabilities to support business success.
9c8c2657-bcd0-4bf6-a542-d0994d9b073e.name: Sales Development Science

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Delivered on-demand with optional weekly, live-online, mentor-led peer roundtables. 7 CEUs
Earned 70% or higher on all end-of-module assessments.
Successfully completed a strategic playbook.

Participated in four to six hours each week completing assignments engaging with content created by industry experts, including hands-on activities and assignments in the online learning portal (LMS).
Engaged in optional, weekly live-online, mentor-led roundtables.

ef9a8dad-6122-4863-9571-fe3c2044883c.description: Individuals in the Web Development Specialization worked on design and development of web systems and applications to support business needs and meet industry standards. As front-end developers, they are up-to-date on the latest relevant programming languages and experienced with major platforms and frameworks for e-commerce, enterprise applications, interactive websites, and cloud applications.
ef9a8dad-6122-4863-9571-fe3c2044883c.name: Web Development Specialization

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the following courses: Designing, Building and Integrating RESTful API; Web Programming: JavaScript and PHP, Introduction, and electives. Met all requirements for Web Development Specialization. Earned 9 units.

0a583dac-9dc4-4451-9f47-160e77a85987.description: Earners have developed the financial, organizational, and communication skills to effectively execute diverse administrative roles. They are competent in business-critical skills; persuasively communicating their ideas to others, creating and using financial statements to manage organizational activities, using CRM systems to promote potent customer interactions, and using project management systems to structure and execute the varied range of projects that are vital to an organization's growth.
0a583dac-9dc4-4451-9f47-160e77a85987.name: Administrative Professionals Specialization

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the following courses: Business Communications and Finance for the Business Professional as well as at least two electives. Met all requirements for an Administrative Professionals Specialization. Earned at least 6.5 UCSC units.
Several of the courses in the Administrative Professionals Specialization qualify for professional credit toward certification organizations, including HRCI® and SHRM.

bdca9fc9-5254-4c0d-8166-fc7898e200e6.description: Students utilized AI Application Development skills in deep learning for data manipulation, statistical analysis, and modeling. They explored the business implications and opportunities associated with AI and how to harness the technology with process integration and enhanced workflows. They built deep learning prediction models from linear logistic regression to categories of neural networks. Students selected an advanced area of study (RL, NLP, GANs) in the industry-oriented capstone project.
bdca9fc9-5254-4c0d-8166-fc7898e200e6.name: AI Application Development Specialization

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the following courses: The Business of AI; Deep Learning and Artificial Intelligence; One advanced elective (Artificial Intelligence for Robotics; Deep Reinforcement Learning; Natural Language Processing; or GANs for Data Synthesis); and Building Integrated AI Applications. Met all requirements for AI Application Development Specialization. Earned 9.5 CEUs.

88b92014-dd54-4107-9b1b-64d4b1eddf0c.description: Participants in our specialization in Data Engineering developed their ability to construct complex databases while optimizing performance. They understand the Big Data concepts, sharpened their RDBMS skills, gained SQL and NoSQL database expertise, and explored the field of the internet of things (IoT).
88b92014-dd54-4107-9b1b-64d4b1eddf0c.name: Data Engineering Specialization

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the following courses: Relational Database Design and SQL Programming; MySQL and Oracle Database for Developers and Designers; Data Engineering with Hadoop. Met all requirements for the Data Engineering Specialization. Earned 8 units.

70706c8a-056a-40c4-89cf-543bd635c655.description: Recipients developed an understanding of data science by learning how to find, organize, manage, and process large volumes of real-world data. In this streamlined package of introductory data science courses, participants performed data manipulation and analysis using Python. By leveraging their mathematical and statistical skills to find patterns, value, and insights, they’ll have gained valuable insights and acquired expertise to create stunning visualizations and statistical models using R.
70706c8a-056a-40c4-89cf-543bd635c655.name: Data Science Specialization

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the following courses: Python for Data Analysis; Data Analysis, Introduction; Dashboards and Data Visualization. Met all requirements for the Data Science Specialization. Earned 9 units.

e1de8e8b-e19a-43d8-8058-c753e055f263.description: Individuals in the DEI for Early Childhood Success Specialization gained insight exploring cultural histories and pervasive obstacles to success in the classroom. They focused on identifying, interacting, and responding to common behaviors and the development of individual values. They curated a toolbox of best practices for positive inclusivity and new mediums of communication.
e1de8e8b-e19a-43d8-8058-c753e055f263.name: DEI for Early Childhood Success Specialization

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the following courses: Cultural Equity for Student Success; Culture and Cultural Diversity; ECE 6: Culture and Diversity in the Early Childhood Classroom; Neurodivergent Learners. Met all requirements for DEI for Early Childhood Success Specialization. Earned CEUs and UC credits.

678d38aa-7fec-45f8-9d8b-58ec6ddcfbb3.description: Destination Silicon Valley Accelerator for Entrepreneurs Specialization—a partnered program with TiE Global and the University of California, Santa Cruz Extension. Recipients will have participated in a rigorous 10-day, immersive, and collaborative learning experience to propel their startup to the next level. They will have covered the art and science of customer acquisition, storytelling, business model innovation, hypothesis testing, venture fundraising, and more, to accelerate their venture.
678d38aa-7fec-45f8-9d8b-58ec6ddcfbb3.name: Destination Silicon Valley Accelerator for Entrepreneurs Specialization

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

alignments.name: TiE Global
alignments.description: TiE Global is a nonprofit organization devoted to entrepreneurs in all industries, at all stages, from incubation, throughout the entrepreneurial lifecycle. With a global reach and a local focus, the heart of TiE efforts lies in its five foundational programs, – Mentoring, Networking, Education, Funding, and Incubation.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will have learned directly from founders and CEOs of successful startups, pitched to investors, and received personalized mentoring from successful entrepreneurs focused on refining their message and business model.
Attendees will have engaged in live consulting projects with Silicon Valley startups.
Individuals will have finished the program with an investment-ready business plan plus investor connections.
Individuals will have had an opportunity to pitch business plans to potential investors.
Participants will have earned 6 CEUs.

9e2c5382-f47f-4f3f-a234-4ce8946295b5.description: The only Silicon Valley systems-focused credential that ensures students apply concepts of virtualization to meet the cost and productivity needs businesses face today. Students studied CPU, storage and network virtualization; designed, coded, and deployed cloud-focused tools to support coworkers; and explored service-oriented architecture and the cloud software development toolchain.
9e2c5382-f47f-4f3f-a234-4ce8946295b5.name: DevOps and Data Virtualization Specialization

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the prerequisite: Networking Fundamentals; the two core courses: DevOps Technologies, and System Virtualization Fundamentals, and electives. Met all the requirements for DevOps and Data Virtualization Specialization. Earned 11 units.

762c078a-4783-4f84-91cd-7a91f007f5ec.description: Individuals have gained the skills to manage and run a daycare center. They have learned to develop a safe and developmentally appropriate learning environment with curriculum and activities for children in various stages of social, emotional, physical and cognitive development, and to develop effective relationships with families. They understand complex licensing, documentation, and record-keeping standards; how to decode healthcare policies; and how to assess policy and personnel practices.
762c078a-4783-4f84-91cd-7a91f007f5ec.name: Early Childhood Education: Site Supervisor

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

alignments.name: Site Supervisor and Program Director credentialing

badge_template_activities.title: Completed four core courses: ECE 10: Supervision and Administration: Parents as Partners in Education; ECE 11: Supervision and Administration of Early Childhood Centers, Part A; ECE 12: Supervision and Administration of Early Childhood Centers, Part B; ECE 13: Adult Supervision and Mentoring. Earned a total of 20 units. Met all requirements for a UCSC Silicon Valley Certificate in Early Childhood Education: Site Supervisor.

926d77ce-c7ff-49aa-a15c-c765485324de.description: Badge-earners developed a strong understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP) concepts that provide the structure for most Java applications and the basis of the language itself. They also acquired deeper insights into Java data structures and algorithms having practiced the core facilities of Java, Java API, created their own libraries, and developed the ability to analyze the most important algorithms. They wrote efficient code using concurrency framework, polymorphism and generics.
926d77ce-c7ff-49aa-a15c-c765485324de.name: Java Development Specialization

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the following courses: Java Programming I; Java Programming II; and Data Structures and Algorithms using Java. Met all requirements for a UCSC Silicon Valley Java Development Specialization. Earned 8 units.

5866a884-c310-411a-a9e1-a8fc97b90f7b.description: Badge recipients are trained in the current knowledge and practices of Agile product life-cycle management (APLM), including Lean-Agile principles, systems thinking, Scrum and Kanban methodologies, and the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe©) for Lean Enterprises. They are prepared to contribute to today's rapidly changing organizations.
5866a884-c310-411a-a9e1-a8fc97b90f7b.name: Lean-Agile Project Management Specialization

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the following courses: Role of the Project Manager; Agile Project Management Using Scrum; and Achieving Organizational Agility using the Scaled Agile Framework, SAFe©; and at least two elective courses. Met all requirements for a Lean-Agile Project Management Specialization. Earned 6 UCSC quarter units.

Our courses align with A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge, PMBOK®️ Guide and fulfill PMI®️'s education requirement towards either the CAPM®️ (Certified Associate in Project Management) or PMP®️ (Project Management Professional) exams. PMI®️, PMBOK®️, PMP®️ and CAPM®️ are registered trademarks of the Project Management Institute.

skills.name: Apply Little's Law Of Process Flow
Implement The Accelerators For Motivation And Innovation
Map Values To Principles To Outcomes
Scaled Agile Framework© (SAFe©) For Lean Enterprises

a4e56c5a-2994-4c02-9b95-e39c82611497.description: Recipients of the Learning Experience Design specialization focused on organizing and delivering learning that will effectively serve diverse learning styles and organizational goals. Guided to expand practical approaches to online learning, the curriculum included facilitation, the use of emerging technologies, intercultural communication, and the evaluation of teaching curriculums. Through assessments, each individual could develop areas in need of special attention.
a4e56c5a-2994-4c02-9b95-e39c82611497.name: Learning Experience Design

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed four core courses. Earned 5.5-8 units. Met all requirements for a UCSC Silicon Valley Specialization in Learning Experience Design.

skills.name: Facilitate And Design Instruction For Employees

ffc7e66c-b7c1-47b1-984a-a150c8d5ae9a.description: This individual is competent in initiating, planning, executing, monitoring, controlling, and closing projects and programs and has learned to adapt and apply best practices to traditional products using waterfall methodologies as well as highly developmental products using contemporary lean-agile frameworks. They practice collaborative leadership and are prepared for the Project Management Institute’s PMP® exam.
ffc7e66c-b7c1-47b1-984a-a150c8d5ae9a.name: Project and Program Management

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed three core courses: Role of the Project Manager, Project Integration and Risk Management or Project Leadership and Communication; and Applied Project Management; as well as three electives. Earned 15 credit units representing 150 contact hours. Met all requirements for a UCSC Silicon Valley Extension Certificate in Project and Program Management.

This certificate prepares students with the skills required to successfully manage a project and to prepare for the PMP®️ or CAPM®️ certification exams. Our courses align with A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge, PMBOK®️ Guide and fulfill PMI®️'s education requirement towards either the CAPM®️ (Certified Associate in Project Management) or PMP®️ (Project Management Professional) exams. PMI®️, PMBOK®️, PMP®️ and CAPM®️ are registered trademarks of the Project Management Institute.

5e513d34-bf6a-4757-8def-0069e15a344a.description: The SOC professional in this integrated circuit program is able to use the latest industry tools in hardware specification to Implement Verilog modeling of digital logic, write assertions for formal verification using SystemVerilog, build an advanced UVM verification environment, implement IO technologies such as PCI Express, Ethernet and Fibre channel, and complete practical designs with Xilinx FPGAs.
5e513d34-bf6a-4757-8def-0069e15a344a.name: VLSI Engineering

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed two of the following courses: Advanced Verification with SystemVerilog OOP Testbench; Analog IC Design, Introduction; Digital Logic Design Using Verilog; Physical Design Flow From Netlist to GDSII; Practical DFT Concepts for ASICs, SoC and SiP; or Analog IC Design, Introduction; as well as at least three elective courses. Met all requirements for a UCSC Silicon Valley Certificate in VLSI Engineering. 14 units.

f5999645-2c71-4f30-8d8f-713c2375b466.description: Individuals have learned to identify how the HR leader can drive DEI initiatives, help correct systemic issues, and develop strategies that support cultural and systemic change to impact the bottom line of an organization positively. They are familiar with tools for effective intercultural global business practices. They are skilled at guiding executives and managers in EEOC processes, recognizing obstacles, avoiding misunderstandings, and preventing formal grievances altogether.
f5999645-2c71-4f30-8d8f-713c2375b466.name: Workplace Cultural Competency

issuer.summary: issued by UCSC Silicon Valley Extension

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the following courses: Conflict Resolution and Mediation; Cultural Proficiency; Strategic DEI Initiatives for HR Professionals. Earned 6.5 credits. Met all the requirements for Workplace Cultural Competency Specialization.
